reviewText:
The second DVD set includes many favorites episodes of mine (Save the Tiger, Last Horizons, The Old Man and the Sea Duck, My Fair Baloo, Jolly Molly christmas...and so many more!)

This series is the best TV series ever produced. The series can appeal to everyone, boys and girls, kids and adults (something that Disney is REALLY lacking nowadays) : it has funny situations and deals with serious matters (sometimes both in the same episode, and it works very well) In fact, EVERYONE who has seen the series later as an adult think it's even better than when they were kids!!! Check around the web if you don't believe me. (and nostalgia has nothing to do with that, unlike most cartoons!)

It has the greatest characters ever made : they have a real depth and multi-sided personalities, which is not very common for cartoons. Even the characters coming from the Jungle Book (especially Baloo and Shere Khan) are much more interesting in TaleSpin! The soundtrack is the best Disney has ever produced for a series. The episodes are very varied, it's never repetitive (which is the biggest flaw of most cartoons nowadays, especially Phineas & Ferb) and the art is magnificent (characters styles and sceneries are a mix of the best of American and Japan animation!)

The only "flaw" would be the sometimes inconsistent animation, due to several production facilities, but the animation is still top notch overall.

It's probably the most underrated Disney production ever, due to them never really backing it unfortunately. It's already a miracle they've released the TaleSpin DVDs! I would really love Disney to come back to it and make a direct-to-video film or even (let's dream) a feature film. It truly deserves it. There are so many great TaleSpin stories that could be told...

NB : If you only have the first set, I REALLY recommend getting this one because it's even better! Pure masterpiece.

While it is great to see a second volume come out, I would really appreciate if Disney would release ALL episodes of Talespin. I have a VHS library which has 9 episodes not contained in either set. Stuck On You, Ransom Of Red Chimp, Flying Dupes, Sound and Furry, Destiny Rides Again, Bygones, Road To Macadamia, Mach One For The Gipper, Incredible Shrinking Molly, Paradise Lost, Your Baloo Is In The Mail are not here. With 9 episodes per disk, this is only 1 extra disk worth of content. Typical Disney cheapness.
This cartoon is as good as I remember it from my childhood. What a blast from the past!
The show is fun but the theme song is a classic! Oh-ee-oh. I co-wrote it, so I might be prejudice!!

I've waited for this collection for a while, and I was finally able to get it.  Volume 2 has some of the best episodes of the show, including "Jolly Molly Christmas", a very touching episode that kids and parents will love.  Unfortunately, the DVD is still lacking in any special features, commentaries, or interviews.  I was hoping they would have that by now, but I guess this is just something Disney does on the side while they devote their energy to making second-hand movie sequels.  But, if you bought volume I, you should definitely get this.  It'll be money well-spent.

Hillarious antics of a Bear and his sidekick as they try to stay a step ahead of the badguys. Good, Clean, Family Entertainment.
A refresher from the "norm" of today's tv shows.

I was so excited when I received this Volume in the mail. It has THE best episode ever on it, "A Jolly Molly Christmas". That episode's ending still makes me cry. It's one of the most beautiful and touching moments ever.. and a wonderful testament to the Christmas spirit and believing. The musical riff that accompanies the whole last scene as the magical snow beings to fall... hits down to the core of my being. Yes I'm a romantic... and this is one of the most magical moments ever on any TV show. A must have!

The second installment of Disney's TaleSpin brings me out of my 'Bear-ish laid-backness' as three of my top five TS episodes are featured here - 'The Old Man & The Sea Duck' (DISC ONE), "For Whom The Bell Klangs" Parts One & Two & 'Citizen Khan' (DISC TWO), "Flight School Confidential" (DISC THREE). Oh, Did I mention "A Jolly Molly Christmas"?? Umm, sounds like a Christmas-time rush to get this. Sadly, this box set doesn't have any added features or interviews from those who helped create this masterpiece 17 -short- years ago. I'm hoping Disney will add extra behind-the-scenes featurettes for the final box set next year (along with comments from co-creator Jymn Magon, Bob Taylor and the remaining surviving voice cast involved with the GREATEST ANIMATED TV SERIES EVER) and maybe have fan video/website features too (Listening Disney??? You have my email on this site.) Thanks for your time. SPIN IT!!! JG

I  sure hope this set has  the really great episodes like Flight School Confidential, Jolly Molly Christmas  (yes Molly there is a santa claus) and  The time bandits. Cartoons today lack serious moral judgement and/or compass. I only let my son watch cartoons that I have pre-screened or remember having some substance to them. The break down is 25 minutes of a  moral dilemma faced down by a little kid named kid cloud kicker and the lovable Baloo from the jungle book. It is a safe and solid cartoon for little kids that are learning where they fit in life. Besides, I have had a chuckle a time or two myself. I've enjoyed sitting and watching a bit with him. I would recommend this to anyone.

This cartoon series was one of my favorite after-school shows on the Disney afternoon. One of the aspects I loved about it was the the pseudo-period style in which it was set. Even as a child, I loved the old-fashioned, art deco influence in the animation, the small quaint shop of Baloo and Rebecca offset by the large art deco buildings of the city in the background. Cape Suzette is visually similar to a sleepy island town on a seaside, like what you would find in a Fellini film. The planes and boats are all old-fashioned World War style planes that exude a certain old-world romantic flair (reminiscent of Casablanca or the African Queen). I also love the laugh-out-loud moments of this series. Rebecca and Baloo's back and fourth can get quite witty, and the Don Carnage character (the villain) has great one liners given in an undeniably hysterical accent. What I love most about this series though is that its main theme is that of friendship and maintaining normal social balances between different sects of society, working together to achieve goals, and enjoying fun while doing good hard work. It's something that all kids, old and young can appreciate. One of my favorite episodes (on the first volume) was one where Rebecca is conned into hauling "expensive" jewels for a snobby, seemingly nouveau-riche couple. Of course, she bends and kowtows to them all the while the couple treats her and Baloo like dirt. Baloo of course saw through their snobbery and, in the end, he and Louis reveal them as the scam-artists they were. Albeit over-dramatized, it's a good lesson to be learned, not to get sucked into the superficial and to stand your ground against those who treat you poorly without due cause. Each episode presents non-controversial, all-American morals and standards that even the most liberal or conservative of people can understand. There are also other, just plain awesome episodes too, like the one where Baloo and Louis visit some Egypt-inspired dessert valley and help the pretty young gal uncover a lost city controlled by bells. The mystery, ethos and pathos, and a general interesting storyline taking place in beautiful animated locations is always present in this series. There really isn't an episode (that I can remember) that I didn't enjoy thoroughly enjoy.

To finish up, I was watching some new kids show with my 9 year old about mermaids. It was good, but I noticed that the show didn't exhibit the same stand-up qualities that these old programs had. Most kids shows today have their characters walking around in skimpy, fashionable outfits, saying niche popular phrases, and not really doing anything of real value to the society in which they reside. The male characters are always buffed out to the max, wearing open shirts and looking dreamy. It's certainly entertaining from a Hollywood perspective, but is it really what we want our kids to be watching before they're 18? I would say no, and thus my recommendation for Tale Spin. At the very least, I am very excited to introduce my nieces and nephew to this show. I really think they're going to love it!

Thanks and I urge anyone to purchase it!

My wife and I both grew up watching Talespin and other classics (Chip 'n' Dale, Ducktales, Gummi Bears etc.) we were very excited when we found all 3 Volumes of Talespin on Amazon for a reasonable price. Shipping was very fast and all 3 items showed up as described.

We have been watching them with our boys and it has been a trip down memory lane. Baloo has always been one of my favorites and his dynamic with Rebecca (based on Rebecca from Cheers) is fun to watch. I was surprised at how I remembered all of the episodes and would highly recommend this series to fans of Disney.

I grew up on 80s and 90s cartoons, and the Disney Afternoon block of programming was a favorite. Tale Spin was easily one of the best programs aired during Disney Afternoon, and I'm thrilled to have the series on DVD to share with my daughter.

TaleSpin was my favorite Disney Afternoon cartoon when it was new on the air. It's a pleasure to see it all again. It stands up to viewing after all these years: the friendships and character interactions, the glorious detail of Cape Suzette (an Art Deco city) and the great stories. A friend adores Don Karnage, but Wildcat is my fave.  Few Disney series rival it for consistency and character development (perhaps Gargoyles). Pull chocks and fly high!
I love this series. It brings back the good ol days when my son was young and watched them. Good solid fun with Disney characters. Good animation.
great show.
great

Our daughter, who is now 26, watched Talespin when she was younger. She loved the cartoon series. It is delightful entertainment. We plan to introduce our two young nieces, ages 6 and 4, to the series. We will more than likely buy the two volume series collection for our daughter so that she can share Talespin with our future grandchildren.

Parents and grandparents, this is wholesome, fun entertainment. Get it for your little ones today.

One of my favorite childhood shows, I was so glad to find it here. Product came quickly, the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the box came slightly damaged but the dvds were in great shape. Other than that I love it.
The DVDs came much earlier than expected, and all in original packaging.  DVDs play mint.  Great to take on a trip- no arguing over what to watch next.

Good old 90's cartoons, they don't make them like this anymore, Watching this takes me back, rushing home after school to watch Ducktales, Talespin, Chip n' Dale & Darkwing Duck, this was before there was 24hr cartoons on so it was more special (For me anyways) for me & my brother.
So all youngsters out there i Highly Recommend getting these & vol. 1 and all the Ducktales, Chip n' Dale & Darkwing Duck sets

Amazingly like several of the Disney cartoons of the late 80's and early 90's the show still holds up amazingly well, and my childhood memories didn't over exaggerate how good the show was like how most our childhood memories are with some of our favorite shows we remember.

The thing I love about this collection is all the different adventures they had and also getting to see quite a few of the characters from the show was fun.  I think anyone who likes the classic disney characters would love this collection.  Highly recommend!

Definetly worth the money, fast shipping, brand new dvd's. What more would you want?!

Great quality DVD of this iconic Disney classic political/social commentary.  Using animation, and Jungle Book Characters in a fictitious late 30's (pre-war) setting, Disney writers take on numerous contemporary issues with a fair, sometimes caustic, and often surprising point of view.  Make no mistake, even though the cartoon antics are entertaining for children, adults will be intrigued.
Just what I wanted and the description was what it said it was. The package was not damaged and was packed in the right size of box.

I grew up watching TaleSpin and I bought the two DVD sets a few years ago. The series is one of the best cartoons ever made. I only wish that Disney would bring Volume Three out.

Disc One:

Disc Two:

For Whom the Bell Klangs - Part One
For Whom the Bell Klangs - Part Two
Citizen Khan
Gruel and Unusual Punishment

Disc Three:

Jumping the Guns
